discussion.content:
If the critical design review has been accepted by the client, the next meeting that should be held to move to the next step in the project is the Execution meeting. Option A is the correct answer.

The critical design review is an important milestone in the project life cycle where the design of the project is reviewed and approved by the client. Once the design has been accepted, the project moves into the execution phase, where the actual work is performed to deliver the project deliverables.

questions.question_text:
The client accepts the critical design review.
Which of the following meetings should be held to move to the NEXT step in the project?

During planning, a project coordinator publishes the project management plan. After reviewing the plan, the project sponsor is concerned it is too long and detailed. Which of the following does the project sponsor desire?

discussion.content:
This should be C. 

It is only in the planning phase and no work has been performed yet. Thus "status report" does not make any sense at this point in time. Project management plan was just too much the sponsor. So, the project schedule is the best option. 

"The purpose of the project schedule is to coordinate activities to form a master plan in order to complete the project objectives on time. It is also used to track schedule performance and keep upper management and project stakeholders informed about the project's status."

Reference: Official CompTIA Project+ Student Guide (pg. 134)

Yes A: 

The the project sponsor has decided they don't want all the long details. A status report is typically shorter than a project schedule. A project schedule is a comprehensive document that outlines all the tasks, timelines, milestones, and dependencies for a project. It provides a detailed plan for the project's execution and helps stakeholders understand the overall scope of the project

questions.question_text:
A project manager is performing resource leveling and notices one of the functional testers is assigned 40% in a second project. The project manager needs the resource to be 100% dedicated to the project; otherwise, the testing phase jeopardizes the delivery date. Which of the following should the project manager do
NEXT?

discussion.content: Assuming this project is functional & PM has to make do with 60% instead of 100% & mitigate the risk.

Resources do not have to be at 100% in leveling. Resource loading is where you need the 100% workforce. In leveling the PM needs to find a balance between the project end date and resource availability. The PM could absolutely ask for 40% more from a different resource but chances are they are going to put the utilized resource at 60% and then look at their mitigation plan to see what the options are.

Slow down fellas. Look at the question. which is MOST involved in checking the qaulity... The provided answer is MOST correct.

D:

A tester is an important member of a software development team who is responsible for ensuring the quality of the deliverables. The role of a tester involves testing the software or application developed by the development team to ensure that it meets the desired requirements, specifications, and user expectations.

In addition to testing, a tester also plays a crucial role in supporting the project manager by providing feedback on the progress of the project, identifying risks and issues that may arise during the project, and suggesting possible solutions to address these issues. The tester's input can help the project manager make informed decisions about the project's progress and any changes that need to be made to meet project objectives.
